rdf:Description.dc:title: Akbar: An Eastern Romance
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Petrus Abraham Samuël van Limburg Brouwer (1829–1873)
rdf:Description.dc:rights: This eBook is for the use of anyone anywhere at no cost and with almost no restrictions whatsoever. You may copy it, give it away or re-use it under the terms of the Project Gutenberg License included with this eBook or online at www.gutenberg.org. This eBook is produced by the Online Distributed Proofreading Team at www.pgdp.net. The Dutch original, Akbar, een Oostersche Roman, is also available from Project Gutenberg. Scans for this work are available from the Internet Archive. (Copy 1.)
rdf:Description.dc:description: Akbar is a Dutch historical novel that takes place at the court of Emperor Akbar in India in the sixteenth century. Although its main personages are historical, the plot is mostly fictional, and the author has taken considerable liberty with facts.
